sentence.Network_en: They're freshly baked. I fetched them from the baker's this morning.

sentence.Network_en: The weather was unkind to those pipers who played in the morning.
sentence.Network_cn: 坏天气对上午那些风笛吹奏者毫不容情。

jx.jx_en_mean: (humorous)the morning after an evening of drinking, when one has a hangover

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from morn, on the pattern of evening

encyclopedia.content: 世上最壮观的就是欣赏白昼的诞生！ 黑夜悄悄隐入山谷和石缝，藏到浓密的树叶下，躲进洒满露珠的草丛中。高耸的山峰温情地微笑着，空中射来第一束阳光，仿佛对柔和的夜影说： “别害怕，这是太阳！” 海浪高高扬起白头，向太阳鞠躬歌唱，犹如美丽的宫女参见皇上： “欢迎您啊，世界的君王！” 仁慈的太阳笑逐颜开；海浪终夜嬉戏翻滚，左回右旋，这时已是乱作一团，她们碧绿的衣衫揉皱了，天鹅绒长裙搓乱了。 “早安！”太阳俯向大

entry.tran: 早晨;上午(从人们通常醒来到中午或午餐前的一段时间)
entry.def: The morning is the part of each day between the time that people usually wake up and 12 o'clock noon or lunchtime.

example.ex: During the morning your guide will take you around the city...
example.tran: 导游上午会带你们游览全城。

example.ex: On Sunday morning Bill was woken by the telephone...
example.tran: 星期天早晨，比尔被电话铃声吵醒了。

entry.tran: 凌晨，早晨，上午(从子夜到中午的这段时间)
entry.def: If you refer to a particular time in the morning, you mean a time between 12 o'clock midnight and 12 o'clock noon.

example.ex: I often stayed up until two or three in the morning...
example.tran: 我经常凌晨两三点才睡。

example.ex: The attack happened in the early hours of the morning.

entry.def: If you say that something will happen in the morning, you mean that it will happen during the morning of the following day.

example.ex: I'll fly it to London in the morning...
example.tran: 我明天上午会把它用航空快件寄到伦敦。

example.ex: Melanie promised that she would call them in the morning.
example.tran: 梅拉妮许诺第二天上午给他们打电话。

entry.tran: 日日夜夜;夜以继日；一直
entry.def: If you say that something happens morning, noon and night, you mean that it happens all the time.

example.ex: You get fit by playing the game, day in, day out, morning, noon and night.
example.tran: 从早到晚都坚持做这项运动，日复一日，你就能强壮起来。

means.word_mean: 1. the time period between dawn and noon;
2. a conventional expression of greeting or farewell
